performance:
The performance of a SPARQL endpoint is crucial for any application using this service. SPARQLES thus performs some tests to estimate the performance of an endpoint relative to other endpoints. In particular, we run a variety of ASK, JOIN and LIMIT queries against endpoints. These queries are designed to estimate performance in a comparable way.

Refer to the Performance description for more information.
Result-size thresholds:
Maximum results returned by engine (tested up to 100,002 results)

SELECT * WHERE {

  ?s ?p ?o

}

LIMIT 100002
ASK queries:
Atomic ASK lookups with one triple pattern

  • s: constant subject
  • p: constant predicate
  • o: constant object
  • sp: constant subject & predicate
  • etc.
JOIN queries:
Queries requiring a fixed number of 1,000 atomic joins

  • ss: subject–subject joins
  • so: subject–object joins
  • oo: object–object joins
Average ASK:
Atomic ASK lookups with one triple pattern

  • s: constant subject
  • p: constant predicate
  • o: constant object
  • sp: constant subject & predicate
  • etc.
Average JOIN:
Queries requiring a fixed number of 1,000 atomic joins

  • ss: subject–subject joins
  • so: subject–object joins
  • oo: object–object joins
Median ASK:
Median response time of all available endpoints using atomic ASK lookups with one triple pattern

  • s: constant subject
  • p: constant predicate
  • o: constant object
  • sp: constant subject & predicate
  • etc.
Median JOIN:
Median response time of all available endpoints using queries requiring a fixed number of 1,000 atomic joins

  • ss: subject–subject joins
  • so: subject–object joins
  • oo: object–object joins
Cold-Warm:
Queries are run twice within an observation to check for caching effects

  • Cold: first run
  • Warm: second run (typically within an hour)
ASKs:
ASK query with bound subject

ASK WHERE {

  <x> ?p ?o

}

(<x> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data)
ASKp:
ASK query with bound predicate

ASK WHERE {

  ?s <y> ?o

}

(<y> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data)
ASKo:
ASK query with bound object

ASK WHERE {

  ?s ?p <z>

}

(<z> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data)
ASKsp:
ASK query with bound subject and predicate

ASK WHERE {

  <x> <y> ?o

}

(<x> and <y> are fresh URIs not appearing in the data)
ASKso:
ASK query with bound subject and object

ASK WHERE {

  <x> ?p <z>

}

(<x> and <z> are fresh URIs not appearing in the data)
ASKpo:
ASK query with bound predicate and object

ASK WHERE {

  ?s <y> <z>

}

(<y> and <z> are fresh URIs not appearing in the data)
ASKspo:
ASK query with bound subject, predicate and object

ASK WHERE {

  <x> <y> <z>

}

(<x>, <y> and <z> are fresh URIs not appearing in the data)
JOINss:
JOIN query that forces 1,000 subject–subject join lookups

SELECT DISTINCT ?s ?p2

WHERE {

  ?s ?p ?o

  OPTIONAL { ?s ?p2 <x> }

}

LIMIT 1000

(<x> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data; forces 1,000 join lookups for any content)
JOINso:
JOIN query that forces 1,000 subject–object join lookups

SELECT DISTINCT ?s ?p2

WHERE {

  ?s ?p ?o

  OPTIONAL { <x> ?p2 ?s }

}

LIMIT 1000

(<x> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data; forces 1,000 join lookups for any content)
JOINoo:
JOIN query that forces 1,000 object–object join lookups

SELECT DISTINCT ?s ?p2

WHERE {

  ?s ?p ?o

  OPTIONAL { <x> ?p2 ?o }

}

LIMIT 1000

(<x> is a fresh URI not appearing in the data; forces 1,000 join lookups for any content)
